content.description: Whispers is the bouldery headwall above the fixed draw warm up Cohiba. Climb up through cruxy pockets above the chains of Cohiba, follow edges and pockets on the best rock in Jacks Canyon to arrive at the anchors. Fixed Draws and Anchors.
content.location: Continue climbing above the warm up cohiba.

content.description: Follow some of the coolest looking holds on the entire wall to the obvious crux: pulling onto the final headwall. Ride the impeccable limestone to the  anchors.
content.location: Left side of the wall. One route to the left of Cohiba (the warm up with chain draws).

climbs.name: Psycho Friends
climbs.fa: FA Chris Hahn, EB Jim Steagall

content.description:
This burly crack climb might feel difficult for the grade if you only face climb.  Head up the right facing dihedral with a combination of jams and liebacks.  At the corner some good footholds provide a nice rest before the crux traverse under the roof.  Extending the draws under the roof will make the final moves easier.  Probably best to TR this one to clean it. 

  "Psycho Friend Network" continuous across the roof to the anchors for Guilty Pleasures for 12b credit, have fun cleaning this one.
content.protection: 9 Bolts to Anchors.  For rope drag consider backcleaning the first bolt and extend the 3 bolts under the roof with long slings.  A short draw on the last bolt keeps the rope from rubbing on the sharp corner of the roof.
content.location: In the center of Main Wall.  Look for the right facing right leaning dihedral, capped by a large roof.

content.description: One route right of Crank Call. Start without cheater blocks on thin side pulls and underclings. Find a way through the series of hidden holds in the middle chose to arrive at a brutally drastic headwall ready to fight for your life. Good Luck.
content.location: One route right of Crank Call. Look for a big jug hole around the second bolt and a large side pull feature on the right.

content.description:
Start up the right facing dihedral past the first two bolts.  Above the second bolt traverse left on jugs clipping the third bolt shared with "Eye Witness Blues".  From here follow the obvious crack up and left utilizing jams but mostly good holds in and to the side of the crack.  At the top of the crack a tricky and awkward mantle is encountered to gain the slab.  Once on the slab the difficulties ease and continue up to the anchors. 

  A second pitch "Chossing the Dragon" is an open project. 

  If you traverse right from the below along the crack below the roof to the anchors on "Guilty Pleasure" it is "Snake Bite Traverse"
content.protection: 9 Bolts to Anchors, consider seconding to clean the route as it both overhangs and leans way to the left.  Also consider backcleaning the first bolt.
content.location: Shares start with "Psycho Friends Network".  Start up the right facing dihedral to the first bolt.  From here break left passing through the line of "Eye Witness Blues" and continue up the left leaning crack.

content.description:
Pull off the ground with a tricky move on a small suspicious pocket and a sidepull and make a tricky move to a good hold.  From here negotiate the burly thin crux on another suspicious pocket and micro crimps to a jug and the first rest.  From here the climbing eases but stays continuous to the anchors. 

  The upper half of this route is really enjoyable but the chipped start hurts the quality of the line.
content.location: This route is located on the middle - right side of Main Wall.  To the left is "Case Study" and to the right is a hard looking Project.  This is the last route on the wall before things get really hard.

content.description: A cool looking line that manages to break through the large roof capping the lower tier of the crag. Off the ground, two engaging sections of climbing lead to a technical and unique crux entering into the dihedral on the left side of the hanging double arête/pillar. Climb to the top of the dihedral and to an obvious rest at the horizontal. Recoup and fire the potentially heartbreaking last boulder problem over the roof. Follow the large flake feature leading to an interesting mantle to clip the anchor.
content.protection: 12 bolts to anchor with fixed carabiners. Stick-clipping the second bolt is nice.
content.location: Start 5ft to the left of the Psycho Friends crack.

content.description: Cruise up and over the obvious dihedral to the anchors at the horizontal under the roof. Sustained climbing on the entire route leads to a heinous boulder problem crux at the top.
content.location: One route to the right of bloody bones.

content.description: Boulder problem start to moderate climbing to harder boulder problem finish on the waterstreaked headwall.

This fun climb is the warmup of the crag, it has fixed draws so you don't even have to clean it.  Start up the easy left facing flake passing a few hangerless studs.  After the flake head up steeper ground on great holds through the choss band to the anchors.   

  Continuing higher up the featureless headwall is a project.
content.location: Located on the left-center side of Main Wall.  Look for the chain draws and obvious left facing flake

content.description: A bouldery start through the first two bolts leads to decent holds at the third bolt.  Engaging climbing through good holds leads to a nice rest at the 5th bolt.  From here a massive undercling move (climbers shorter than 5`5" or so beware)  leads to big cranks between good holds with minimal feet.  Finally a good flake provides a rest before clipping the chains.
content.protection: 7 Bolts to Anchors, consider stickclipping the second bolt.
content.location: Towards the right side of Main wall.  4th route right of the dihedral route "Psycho Friends".  2nd route left of the very difficult looking open project routes.

content.description: This is the obvious thin crack that starts up the center of Main Wall and ends at the anchors shared with "Psycho Friends".  A bouldery start past the first few bolts leads to a good hold and the third bolt.  From here technical climbing on fingerlocks and the occasional face hold leads up to the roof above.  Pull the roof on good holds and crank up to the lip to clip the anchors.
content.protection: 8 Bolts to Anchors shared with "Psycho Friends"
content.location: In the center of Mainwall.  First route right of the large right facing dihedral that is "Psycho Friends".  Next route to the right is "Evil Vortex Party".

content.description: A great steep and thuggy line, which is a rarity outside bouldering for the Flagstaff area. Begin below a short bulge and make some engaging moves to the break. Surmount another small ledge feature to the start of the meat of the climbing. Make your way out the steep section to a powerful and dynamic crux through the headwall.
content.protection: Bolts to anchors. An alpine draw may come in handy as well as some longer draws to aid a smooth rope line.
content.location: Starts below the steepest part of the left side of the main wall. The second route right of Cohiba (warmup with chain draws).

content.description: This great looking wall contains around 20 established routes and 5 open projects.  The left side of the wall is overhanging to a small roof at the top and then an overhanging headwall.  The right side is on more vertical clean limestone.  Grades range from 10c to 14a, with the majority being 12's and 13's.
